website_summaries.verdict: A durable, heavy duty pool brush with a unique design that allows the user to clean with impressive force.
pros: Because of the 11-inch fin that is attached to the back of this brush, the flow of the water holds the bristles firmly against the pool wall as you push
When you pull, the fin changes position and continues to provide downward pressure
cons: The fin can make it more difficult to maneuver in directions other than up and down
It also inhibits rapid back-and-forth scrubbing motions

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an awesome product - a very good idea. Such a simple modification to a standard brush makes a big difference. Just pushing the brush gives it strong pressure to scrub the walls. pulling it back, the fin flips back and makes the brush return to you. The amount of pressure can be adjusted by moving the adjuster. I have mine on strongest, and it is great. The brush is good too. I was worried that it would be a junk brush, but it is actually a nice metal body brush with the whale fin bolted to it. Seems to be very high quality. It frees up my other hand for a refreshing beverage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: burr on brush sliced pool liner!!
customer_reviews.text: First use of this brush resulted in catastrophe! Brushing the pool close to the wall and the brush sliced through the liner with razor like proficiency. A small slice then allowed water to flush the sand out and ultimately a 3 foot gash opened up and 14000 gallons of water came gushing out. destroyed my pool, patio, flooded my garage and basement and ruined my weekend. $500+ of materials to repair. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Frank W Spratt

customer_reviews.title: The hype about the whale tail creating a lot of downward pressure is all true with one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great brush and the hype about the whale tail creating a lot of downward pressure is all true. It's much better at cleaning than my old brush because of the downward force that's applied. You can even adjust how much you want. I highly recommend this brush. After using this brush I have found one caveat. After a few months the metal portion of the brush started to corrode badly. It looks like some kind of pot metal and should have been made in plastic. Even when I clean the corrosion off it quickly gets covered in crystals again. Otherwise, it's an excellent brush and still going strong after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: It worked on horizontal surfaces, but no so much on the walls. I think if i had a 10' deep pool, this might be helpful. I found that my 3,4,5' deep pool didn't really get anything out of it; if anything, the tail just made things more inconvenient. Brushing with a standard brush just isn't that hard... Product returned.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Makes brushing a lot easier, but metal corrosion and flap cracks are a concern
customer_reviews.text: I have a new 23000 gallon in-ground pool, which needs twice daily brushing as a requirement for proper plaster hydration. This product makes the brushing task much easier. Money well-spent. However, even though pool chemistry has been rigorously maintained to be ideal at all times, after 2 months of use very significant metal corrosion is apparent, lots of rust at bristle base. The flap is also starting to show stress cracks. Not sure how much longer this brush will last.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Chevalier

customer_reviews.title: Bristles are toooo soft to do any brushing good.
customer_reviews.text: The whale fin is exactly as expected. Adjustable and applies pressure on the down sweep. But the brush bristles are soo soft the sweep does no good. I would not recommend this product for brushing pools walls - the bristles are LTA. I took the whale fin and hinge mechanism off and put it on another pool brush with bristles that actually brush. I have a pebble tec in ground pool with inline clorinator. I brush about once every 2 weeks to remove any slight mustard algae that starts to purchase. This brush would not even take mustard algae off. I had a whale brush years ago, bought at the pool store. It worked well, this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed and works well
customer_reviews.text: After utilizing the standard pool brush for the better part of two years I decided to give this thing to go and I tell you what it works and it works well the faster you push the more downforce it applies meaning the faster you can clean your pool I don't like being out there for an hour scrubbing the walls and the floor of my pool so the speed increase and the scrubbing power of this tool made the job easier
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for brushing walls!
customer_reviews.text: Let's admit it: brushing your pool is fun the very first time because it's new. Anything after that is a chore. It's particularly hard to brush the walls especially in the deep end - and when you have back and neck issues like I do, it's a two hand, grunting, sweating job. With this little gismo I can now brush my pool walls with one hand and looking very glamorous in my silk sari and cocktail in the other hand. Joking aside though, this really works as advertised so I bought one for my friends who just built their pool, and will save them from what was my personal slice of purgatorium for the past 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gaudet

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea this is
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea this is. This brush really works well for my pool walls. I also like that it is angles on both ends to fit the curves of the pool. The only con I can think of is that it's not so easy to use for the stairs where smaller strokes are required. I just got my pool replastered and needed to brush all surfaces of the pool and found this to be heavy and also didnt want to damage the soft plaster with the fin. The fin can be easily unscrewed from the top. When the pool plaster is all set, I'll put it back in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Phu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the BEST brush. We have a very large, and, at the deep end, a very deep pool. In our climate, which is generally quite hot and humid in the summer, with a lot of rain. This tends to create a terrific environment for algae, even when all the various chemicals are used to try to keep it to a minimum. The other day, I tried to brush the sides with our regular pool brush and the position is so awkward and painful that I went in search of something to make this process easier and get good pressure on the wall. Came across The Wall Whale, and it is money VERY well spent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - do not hesitate
customer_reviews.text: We opened our pool this week (first time opening it), and I tried to brush the sides with the normal brush the builder provided for us -- big mistake! My back and my shoulders were killing me within 5 minutes, and hardly any progress made on the scrubbing. I ordered this and was able to scrub my entire 16x32 pool in under 30 minutes -- and with just a little effort. I wouldn't say it was as easy as doing it with one hand, but definitely doable for a 5'3" female that is not used to physical exertion. I am very glad I got this, my pool is clean and ready to go now.
customer_reviews.author: golni5

customer_reviews.title: Tail too long and brush too soft
customer_reviews.text: I had a "tailed" brush previously. and have been unable to find a replacement of the same brand/design. The difference between these two was the length of the tail (?). The tail on this model, in my opinion, is 1-2 inches too long. The distance the tail travels on the swivel during the up and down stroke makes the motion bouncy. the first foot or more on the downstroke has the tail swiveling and bouncing into position. it has an adjustment but that doesn't address this problem.. Additionally. there should be an option for a brush that has combination bristles. These bristles are too soft for getting at tough algae spots
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires Much Less Effort
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these since I owned my first pool in 2008. Without the whale tail you have to hold the brush against the wall yourself. If you have a large pool, or even a medium sized pool, it's a workout to brush the walls. With the whale tail, it requires virtually no effort to keep the brush tight against the wall. You literally just need to hold the brush and slightly push it down and the tail pushes the brush against the wall. I would not own a pool without this magnificent device!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Happy Scrubbing!
customer_reviews.text: We recently put in a plaster pool and as you may know, you have to religiously scrub the plaster for a few weeks when it’s fresh. This was an absolute life saver during those few grueling weeks! We still use it now, but much less frequently. We would absolutely recommend to anyone with a new pool! Happy scrubbing!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: It is a product that do not accomplished the anounce
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush following the anounce that the force used will be 10 time less, to clean pool side wall, but is not true due to you need to move the Whale Wall inside watter and its consume a many force with your arms, and the most incredible is that when it return the Whale wall do not function, you need to do more effort to keep close to the pool side wall. Realy from now on I need to use more force to move this brush, inside pool, with whale wall, is a very merchandise product, it do not cover my espectation
customer_reviews.author: Cumana43

customer_reviews.title: Great brush!
customer_reviews.text: This is sooo much better than the old standard pool brush I used. The pressure the wing puts on the head really keeps it pushing down when brushing the pool bottom or sides. I used to have to trouble keeping the brush working well when brushing the bottom of an 8' deep pool, but now it is SO much easier. When pushing forward, the wing causes an automatic downward pressure keeping the head scrubbing with a good force even when I have the pole extended all the way. This is a back saver! One of my best purchases for the pool - great buy!
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Brushing a pool without one of these is a pain, but this device really works well to keep the brush against the side and bottom of the pool with enough pressure to do a great job on the first push. I've used one for years until it recently broke. Temporarily going back to a brush without the "Whale Tail" really made me appreciate how well these work. I was surprised that the local pool store stopped carrying these because they didn't sell well. I hope this company continues to make these because I wouldn't want to brush my pool without one ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S

customer_reviews.title: Great for walls of pool!
customer_reviews.text: It does work on the walls as they describe. It is more difficult to maneuver on the steps and bench area because of the restrictive pull from the whale tail. I have a salt water pool and after the first use their is corrosion on the metal parts of the unit. I have that on my former pool brush. Other than the unattractive look of the metal corrosion, it seems that it will not affect the performance. Overall, it is nice that the walls are finally getting cleaned completely because of the help of the whale tail. I recommend this product. I will write another review later if the corrosion becomes a problem.
customer_reviews.author: McGeeVRJL

customer_reviews.title: I'd be on an island right now if I'd thought of this
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I think of this?! I've been the pool "guy" at our house for a few years now. I hate brushing the pool. I always miss a spot or there's not enough friction. This tames both of those beasts. The brush I'm replacing was about two seasons old and bristles had fallen out at one end, probably because of how it worked in the pool. This brush maintained full and even contact on the sides. I started at medium setting but lowered it to one above high and it worked great for me. I don't know about the one handed claim but it wasn't an unpleasant experience. Great find.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Started to corrode the first week
customer_reviews.text: Used in my saltwater pool forn1 week. Wash of with fresh water after ever use and stored in garage. It still corroded. To the fact I was defeating the purpose of cleaning my pool by sticking a corroding pool cleaner in the pool. In theory at work great and put a lot of pressure on the walls. However they need to change the material if they expect any long-term use from salt water pools. I expected some corrosion that's why I wash it off with fresh water and it still didn't help after every use. I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: Really find this pool brush helpful in the ease with which you can clean the sides of the pool. No longer a dreaded task. It is a bit more cumbersome than a traditional brush, but the pros, by far, outweigh the cons. Looks like it's sturdy enough to last a few seasons. Haven't seen any bristles come out in the two months we've owned it. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GPerry

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just for the brush--which appeared sturdier than others at that price point--and was skeptical about the fin, but ended up being blown away by its effectiveness. The angle of the fin is determined by a plastic spacer attached to the fin in one of 5 or 6 positions; at the angle I tried (somewhere in the middle) it created an incredible force towards the wall, letting me concentrate just on the up/down motion. Pushing down is obviously made quite a bit harder than without the fin, but the simple fact that no extra effort is now required to push against the wall with awkward angling & pulling makes this very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Kunci

customer_reviews.title: makes pool brushing much less of a backbreaker
customer_reviews.text: our pool is 7' at the deep end and it was difficult to brush the walls with standard brushes. this ingenious design has made my life more bearable since I don't have to stretch far out over the pool using both hands to attempt to keep the brush in contact with the wall. kudos to the designer and the company's quality.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Good not great, but better than others
customer_reviews.text: The brush definitely moves down the wall easier because of the whale flap. But I liked the idea that I could use this brush with one hand which is not possible for me. It still takes 2 hands to make sure that brush is at the right angle to brush the pool wall and the plastic edge is not scraping the wall. I think the angle of the brush needs to be adjusted. Also, I do not understand why pool brushes are designed with each end curved up. This seems pretty useless except perhaps for brushing the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Cornish

customer_reviews.title: A MUST
customer_reviews.text: A necessity! Our 6 foot retaining wall made brushing the 8 foot deep end very difficult and nerve-racking. From the very first brushstroke until I completed the entire outer walls of the pool, I was very impressed. The product does exactly what it says and has taken all of the hard work out of brushing the walls. The only reason I gave it four stars on easy to use is because I will use a separate brush do the bottom of the pool and the steps. It can be done with this product but it’s almost too forceful even after you remove the adjustable clip.
customer_reviews.author: calarco511

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fin on a subpar brush
customer_reviews.text: The whale fin works just as described. Keeps the brush against the wall w ease. I love the functionality of the fin. However, the brush is too soft. I have to brush the same spot over and over and over again. Most of the time I have to get my regular brush out to rebrush because I can’t get the wall completely clean w the fin brush. If the fin were on a brush with firmer bristles, I would give it 20 stars! I LOVE the concept & the ease, but it defeats the purpose if I’m doing double the work because the bristles aren’t strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cori LV

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea! A spoiler on a brush!
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea! A spoiler on a brush. The faster you push it, the more downforce it generates, just like with a race car! I have a bad back and trying to scrub down the sides of my pool becomes an extremely painful ordeal. Until I found out about this whale-tailed brush. Man, does it work great! If you're trying to stay on top of your pool's maintenance, one necessary step is to brush down the sides. This whale tail, which comes with a very sturdy brush, by the way, works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McBroom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.  You must buy one.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my this brush is wonderful and has a feature I wasn't expecting. If you watch the video you see how you put the brush up to the top side of the pool then use one hand and push down and brush the walls. It works exactly perfectly. Its adjustable, here is why. The flap on top of the brush can be made to push a tremendous amount of water or a little amount of water. So when you brush the bottom of the pool it also pushes a amount of water. Lots of water on the medium to large setting. This really pushes the dirt along.
customer_reviews.author: David Daughtrey

customer_reviews.title: Improves pool wall scrubbing
customer_reviews.text: The whale-tail shaped plate flips down when the brush is pulled up, and vice versa. Either way, the force of the water moving over the whale's tail pushes the brush into the wall, keeping it in contact with the wall without much effort on the operator's part. Further, the contact force is sufficient to produce a good scrubbing action. One can even do relatively short up and down strokes. It works equally well on the floor of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Ron

customer_reviews.title: The Wall Whale Classic Swimming Pool Brush
customer_reviews.text: Don't aggravate yourself by purchasing other pool brushes, especially if you are interested in cleaning the sides of your pool. If have tried other brushes but none of them will stay against the side of the pool. They all drift away from the side unless you use two hands and force it against the side. That works fine at the top of the side but when you get into deeper water it is impossible to keep it against the wall being cleaned. The Wall Whale Pool Brush eliminates this problem and is the best brush I have found to date. Do yourself a favor and forget the other brushes and get this one. You will be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Every pool owner should have this!
customer_reviews.text: Nobody likes to talk about it, but at some time or other, you're going to end up with algae in your pool. I have tried so many different brushes and they all sucked. I bought this when I put up an intex above ground pool one year, and I was BLOWN AWAY. I can't believe I wasted all that time and money on other brushes. This thing is killer! It sticks where you want it to thanks to the whale tale, and it saves your arms because it uses the water to apply pressure. Seriously, if you have a pool, you NEED this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palkovic

customer_reviews.title: Sceptical at first.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a try after my old brush broke. I figure if I didn't like the tail I could just remove it. I was actually surprised that the tail makes a difference. The tail does supply a fair amount of down force not only when cleaning the side of the pool but also the bottom. My old brush would lift up off the surface at the end of a cleaning stroke which this brush doesn't do. It also seems well made and I don't anticipate any problems in the future. Overall this is a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde K. Miller IV

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tried the brush out today and was pretty pleased. It does push against the walls and floor of the pool so all you have to do is push forward, not down. I would buy it again no problem. The only option I would like to see is a stiffer brush or one with stainless bristles to allow for more aggressive cleaning. The standard brush is fine for daily cleaning and keeping he pool clean. A neglected pool or one with organic stains will require something with more muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Outsource It For Profit

customer_reviews.title: Great flap, bristles too soft
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product based on reviews. My own review is as follows: 5 star for the action of the flap, it does indeed work as described to push brush into the wall as you clean. But I give 2 stars for the bristles, they are very soft so only remove very new mold or mild debris on pool wall. If it is a more rooted problem the soft bristles do not help to lift the mold or debris. So considering these two factors my overall review is a 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I just had my pool resurfaced so I have to have it brushed two times a day for at least 10 days. my old brush was a problem because when you're brushing down the side walls it skips off the wall and it's very hard on your back. The pool is deep and one or two swipes with this brush and I knew right away it was going to be perfect because there is no strain whatsoever on my back and since I have a bad back anyway, this was perfect! You can stand straight up while brushing and never have to bend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We used it for the first time on our pool and within 5 minutes, one of the pins that holds the whale wall to the brush bent and the whale part came off. Now we have an expensive hard to push brush. We have requested a replacement that will hopefully work
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: The fin makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed at first thinking I could figure out how to use it on my own. But then I read the instructions on how to adjust the fin and it make a big difference. I water passing over the fin pushed the brush against the wall with very little effort on my part. With my previous brush I had to use both arms and a lot of strength to attempt to apply enough pressure to clean the wall. I don't brush my pool very often since I have a robotic cleaner, but this is a nice option when a manual brushing is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What Was I Doing Before?  L O V E It.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush. I used to have to spend 30-45 minutes brushing the pool 3 times a week, and algae would come right back. Now I brush it for 15 minutes once a week, and the pool looks better than ever before. L O V E it. It's not cheap, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: A brush with a tail.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely holds against pool side more easily than without the "tail." Like the somewhat softer bristles too. Seems to do good job loosening algae from pool walls. Easier to operate than standard type brushes. Will see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: reddwarf

customer_reviews.title: The whale tail does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pool brush if you remove the whale tail. 4 stars for the plain brush, but the whale tail is a useless gimmick. That feature does not work as described. While the whale tail does give you more oomph while brushing down toward the bottom of the pool, it flips over when you try to brush back up toward the top of the pool, and ends up requiring a great deal more effort than just using it as a regular pool brush.
customer_reviews.author: All Day Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not a Gimmick, I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Believe the hype, this makes brushing so much easier. It applies the exact right amount of pressure without trying to torque the pool. I would buy this again in a heart beat. Pros: Huge benefit if you have any algae. sweep it away with adjustable pressure. Replace the bristles and keep the whale Cons: Not as easy to move side to side. Not a major impact as you should be sweeping long rows next to one another like you mow the lawn. Overall: I have bought a lot of pool Gimmicks trying to save time dealing with the pool, this one was one of the few that blew me away!
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Lagers

customer_reviews.title: Effortless
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a pool so we got one and now I do the maintenance . We were not happy with the pool Mx company so I took it over. If it’s one thing I hate about having to maintain a pool it would be the brushing. This brush is great, the walls are the hardest to brush. This brush hugs the surface wether it is the pool wall or the floor and feels effortless. I’ve had the brush over a year and yes it has corrosion and looks like they used pot metal but it hasn’t affected the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it stays on.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the pressure that this brush seems to put on the pool surface when you use it. The amount of effort you have to put into it is so much less since it puts pressure on the brush on its own. Brushing the sides and bottom of my pool is fairly effortless. The thing that kept me from rating it higher is that is comes off of the pole too often. This means I have to take time to fish it out of the pool and put it back on the pole. This also means that you may be saving effort, but for me, not time.
customer_reviews.author: STOREGON

customer_reviews.title: Big back saver
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Definitely holds the breath against the side for brushing. My back was killing me from trying to keep pressure on the brush without it. Highly recommend! My pool is new and I got the regular brush and pool with my pool. This should have been included! IMO. Thank Greg! Sorry it took me a few months to buy your great pool brush add on. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: My pool is not terribly deep, especially around the walls but, it is certainly wide. I am 5'3" so this thing has been a lifesaver! It provides just enough force to keep the brush on the walls and floors without too much extra effort. Doesn't do too well on the steps but, I don't think it's intended to work in such shallow water. It is easy enough to remove the fin or, place it on the least resistant setting in order to work on the steps. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the coolest thing I've found on amazon in a while. I am shocked at how good and easy it is to use on the pool walls. You literally can use just one hand and what I like the best is no more back aches. I've also noticed I can go around our fairly large in ground pool in less than half the time I did before. Cannot recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.W.

customer_reviews.title: The Wall Whale Great But Pole Sent Didn't Fit the Wall Whale
customer_reviews.text: The Wall Whale worked great, but the pole ordered with it would not fit the Wall Whale. They immediately sent another pole which didn't fit either because the diameter of the pole at the connection was the same size. However, the Wall Whale worked great on a pole we had. The made an offer to refund. The Wall Whale itself gets five stars, but gave it four stars because of pole problems.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for your pool
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love this!! It makes sweeping the walls & floor of my in ground pool so much easier! Only have to push brush against wall at top but once it underwater you can use one hand on the pole and it does better than when I was struggling to hold the brush against the wall. Absolutely great product... Time will tell if it lasts
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a nerd at heart and this thing is a simple solution that works really well. The "tail" actually pushes it into whatever surface you are working so you don't have to. Just push forward (or down if you are doing the walls) and the tail presses the bristles into the surface. Ingenious solution that cuts the time and energy in half.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best pool brush ever!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to give 5's unless deserved.. only used once, but man was today, 6/20/2020. I have same yellow algae on all 4 walls of my 8' deep pool. Used my older brush and it is a lot of work to keep against the wall. Set the fin on max on this brush and all you have to do is push it to the bottom. All four walls on abouth 1/2 hour. Wow...great!
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and holds bottom well. Great for job. Only issue is on steps and around corners it scares a bit. If this brisk had a round head it would be 5 star. I just ordered the round brush for tight areas. Overall does a good job holding bottom and pushing dirt in a ten foot deep pool.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised 👍
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Holds brush on the walls and especially when sweeping the bottom of the pool. I can easily sweep the bottom of our 16’ from one point if I want to. I was skeptical if it was worth a bit more but definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but needs firmer bristles
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a nice product, but limited usability. No crevice work, only for straight vertical or horizontal walls. My main issue is the bristles are way softer than they should be and when pushing down the brush frame drags along the pool surface. I can see where the brush attaches with metal screws, so I will see of I can replace with a firmer brush.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great for deep end walls
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Shipping was great and it was easy to get started and to use. For me, I have found that I prefer a regular brush for most of my pool, but definitely prefer this brush for walls 4 ft and deeper. I can just do a hand over hand to push the brush down and with the fin at level 4 (5 is max), it gives me good friction on the wall and really saves my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Ben J

customer_reviews.title: This is the Easiest!
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest and most effective pool brush I have ever used. It seems slightly expensive but it would be worth 5 times the price in the amount of labor saved. You don't have to hold it against the wall so it never leaves the wall hence every stroke is cleaning the wall. I can do the whole pool in 10 minutes where as with a conventional brush it would take 45 minutes with a lot of back and arm pain. Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Inman

customer_reviews.title: Very good and effective product.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. After seeing a lot of mixed reviews I was skeptical but I’ve used it a couple of times and have had a good experience does clean well not sure if it’s 10 times the pressure with the plate but it certainly helps.
customer_reviews.author: Rishi M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning the pool faster and easier
customer_reviews.text: Provides so much more scrubbing power for brushing the pool walls compared to a standard pool brush. I don’t like how the whale tail fin flips up and down when I’m cleaning the pool so I used some galvanized bailing wire to hold the tail up by wiring it to the cleaning pole. Now it’s so quick to clean the pool walls!
customer_reviews.author: superdataman

customer_reviews.title: You can watch it decay before your eyes.
customer_reviews.text: The aluminium is corroding away already. They should have used stainless steel; it'll have to be thrown out after a single season. Otherwise, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Brain in a Vat

customer_reviews.title: Great, effective brush that is easy to use and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Totally surprised on this one! Thought it looked like more of a gimmick than an actual piece of equipment but boy was I wrong. Have an older large swimming pool and algae is a constant problem especially in the warmer months. Power brushing walls was almost impossible until I tried this brush. Easily adjusted for angle, the whale tail on this provides enough push against the wall to remove even the most stubborn algae. Will update the review as I continue to use the Whale.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Definitely can be used one handed
customer_reviews.text: Definitely easier to brush a pool with this vs the older standard brush. Only time will tell how long this will last in a salt water based pool, but if it lasts 2-3 seasons Im happy with that as its really impossible to expect these products (unless its marine grade stainless steel for all hardware) to last longer at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: DixitS

customer_reviews.title: Good product - questionable QA
customer_reviews.text: Ours arrived with a screw loose, it was easy to fix as fortunately the screw was still there, it just wasn't screwed in. The photo shows how it was when it arrived. Aside from that the mechanism feels effective, so for now 5 star on design and product in general. 3 star or less on assembly quality.
customer_reviews.author: harborview.8

customer_reviews.title: Great brush. Beware salt
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than a regular brush. Increases pressure against the wall significantly and reduces effort. However, if you have a salt pool, it will get crusted with salt build up. Probably best to rinse it off with fresh water after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not universal
customer_reviews.text: I cant use this because it doesn't fit the universal pole. Im not sure I will use it because the left and right curved edges are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Life changing pool product
customer_reviews.text: Life changing pool product!!! Brushing the pool used to kill my back and now it takes no effort at all!! With my regular pool brush I had to break the pool into sections and do a little at a time but with the wall whale I can do the entire pool at once! I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Adams

customer_reviews.title: My husband was shocked at how well this worked!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my husband as he needed a new one... and he is very skeptical about any non-standard 'feature'. Well he came in from cleaning the pool and actually had to compliment this device... it works! He is very happy now and I was proven right ;P.
customer_reviews.author: Felina

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability
customer_reviews.text: Far more discolored? Not sure if it from rust. I may take the whale tail off an put it one of my other brushes. Also this is an all nylon brush. So the quality of the brush is not as good as the ones with the hard bristles with a mix of stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: bad execution of a good idea
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work but it was no good. The idea works but this thing broke after one use. I noticed the screw holding the whale tail was stripped. Not worth the cost. The brush head is very soft. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Wall Whale for years. It finally broke. I’m glad it is still being sold. The whale tail presses the brush bristles against the pool wall as you push the brush down so each brush stroke is effective. So much easier than trying to press the brush against the wall yourself.
customer_reviews.author: LHampton

customer_reviews.title: Brush exerts proper pressure at distance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush on the recommendation of a professional pool cleaner. I have lived in a pool homes for over ten years and wish I had bought this brush sooner. Even when using it with its pole extended to over 20 feet, I can feel strong resistance of the brush against the floor and walls. The only question is its durability, but it does seem well-made. I think that even it it lasts only three years, though, it is worth the money because of its superior performance.
customer_reviews.author: Space Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: WOW Amazing Product...
customer_reviews.text: Best pool brush I've ever used, looks very good quality and should last for years and years, but even if it only lasts for one year, I would buy again no second thoughts, it makes a huge difference on the amount of force you need to apply to clean your pool when compared to normal brush. I'm a 40 something male with a heavy build, this is so easy to use, I'm barely pushing into my pool walls/floors and it cleans so much more than before using normal brush applying my full force/weight. I would recommend to all my friends, most definitively worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: Franco MacIas

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 1/2 years :(
customer_reviews.text: This brush was very good for walls but definitely not for stairs or benches (the flap part made it overly difficult to push for flat surfaces). That bumped it down to 3 stars but the fact that it broke in less than 2 years bumped it down to 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Walking in the Sunlight

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The whale tale itself really does aid in keeping the brush against the wall, but I find the bristles to be too soft and they just smoosh down to where the hinge of the tale or edge of the brush is scraping the pool walls/floor.
customer_reviews.author: 1dawoman

customer_reviews.title: Good Broom - Not sure about the fin
customer_reviews.text: This broom is fine; works well, good price. There are a lot of rave reviews of the fin. I don't feel like the fin gives me more power or really has any purpose at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have curved deep end walls on my pool, this brush pushes itself down onto the sloped wall. Makes it so much easier to brush these walls I would have to otherwise push the brush down and in to get the walls scrubbed,
customer_reviews.author: B. Poles

customer_reviews.title: BEST BRUSH EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pool brush is AMAZING!! It absolutely does what it says! I can brush my entire 22,000 gallon pool with one hand, in under 5 minutes. Does not take an effort using it and it brushes great. If you have a pool, you need this!
customer_reviews.author: TaylorS01

customer_reviews.title: Makes brushing easier!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying one of these. We went a few years without a pool and now back at it. Had a regular brush for a bit but missed the Wall Whale so ordered another. Brushing from Inside or outside the pool, both are easier with this!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn J.

customer_reviews.title: Helps and keeps Rush closer to wall if you have a bad back help some. Need stronger bristles
customer_reviews.text: Definitely makes brushing a little bit easier for my bad back. It does keep the brush closer to the wall on the downstroke. My pool company advises a stronger bristle though for my newly finished in-ground pool.
customer_reviews.author: Joy813

customer_reviews.title: Great pol buush.
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great invention, it does a great job sweeping the surface of your pool, I gave it 4 stars on ease of use due to the fact that you have to exert more force to use this brush, not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: chuktuk44

customer_reviews.title: Was good until a key piece failed, now I can't use it!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this pool brush for almost a year and a half, but the plastic nubs on the handle base have now worn off just enough that it will not stayed secured. I can't find anyway to contact the manufacturer for a replacement. So bummed! Not worth the money in the long run if you have to keep replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Teri McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Brush bristles are toooooo soft.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay on the walls of the pool, but it did not remove most of the algae sticking to the bottom of the pool,no matter how hard i pushed it. The old brush with wires in it worked much better. This would be a great item if hey made the bristles more stiff. Not happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Not as well built as my older brush.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if this a new model or if I procured the wrong model, built it looks cheap and flimsy. The brush is not as wide as the old unit with fewer and very flimsy bristles. I do not think this will last long only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cleaning the pool. Puts pressure against the wall and scrubs the dirt right off. Also works perfectly on the floor of the pool adding the same pressure. Definitely will recommend to anyone with a pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this long ago
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a difference! I was on a replacement kit with pool supplies and my brush was older and kinda cruddy and I found this. The tail makes such an amazing difference and if you don't have one of these you need one!
customer_reviews.author: B-lo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've known about this brush sooner! It makes brushing the pool so much easier. I read one review that said something along the lines of the brush sliced his vinyl liner. The brush has nylon bristles, it would be nearly impossible to slice a vinyl liner. Unless it waa eteremely worn out. Anyway FABULOUS product! Thank you Jules4721
customer_reviews.author: Jules4721

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, pole needs stop
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, the panel makes such a difference in the cleaning and also helps when you’re trying to move the dirt to a drain. I’ve ended up using it for other things like scraping mold off my roof!
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, time and the environment and buy a better brush to begin with.
customer_reviews.text: This does not work effectively. I'm actually online to order a new pool brush because this one is failing (miserably) to perform. Walls aren't getting clean no matter how much elbow grease I'm applying. It's just a waste of $28. Save your money, time and the environment and buy a better brush to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Best idea anyone ever had about pool brush!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get be a senior citizen these tasks get more difficult. This tool makes it so much easier! Just wish the bristles were longer. It is difficult to really get into to corners. Just 3/4 of an inch longer would help a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Mary D. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Great item, Fast shipping, Excellent communication, A+A+A+
customer_reviews.text: Priceless and has remedied my back problems with old brush.
customer_reviews.author: alexander schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write many reviews, but this thing impressed me enough to do one. It does all of the work for you. I have only used it twice. It makes cleaning the walls of my pool a breeze. I would recommend this brush to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Beyond a regular pool brush.
customer_reviews.text: Be ready to be as excited as anyone can be over a pool brush. It stays on contact with the surface very easily. Creates a current so that the particulate matter becomes unsettled and your pool’s filter takes care of the rest.
customer_reviews.author: East Kentucky Bushwacker

customer_reviews.title: Makes Cleaning the Pool so much easier
customer_reviews.text: That fin attachment is really great. Pushes the brush more firmly against the wall and makes brushing the side of the pool SO much easier. It's a brilliant design. I've been using the brush for about a year now in AZ and have had no issues at all. I can imagine it will last for years to come but if I ever needed to replace it, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani F

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Tool
customer_reviews.text: This does what it says, and helps keep the brush to the side of the pool. I cannot speak to stuffiness yet as I have not had it that long. A little pricey, but it does take some of the labor out of weekly pool brushing.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Worked Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This brush works very well at cleaning the sides of pool, especially for the deeper end of the pool. We have a pool that goes from 3 feet to just over 6 feet and we always found it difficult to keep the brush against the sides of the pool when cleaning it from above. This special brush allows me to brush the sides easier by putting pressure on the brush, forcing it against the wall as I brush. An added benefit is it makes cleaning the walls easier if you have to brush the wall from an angle, when you can't brush from directly above the area. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Abraham

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived missing a key part that regulates the pressure in the brush. I notified amazon through the return/defective notification on Saturday afternoon and I had a perfect replacement on Monday morning. Awesome service. The new one works great and the whale fin really helps and makes brushing the pool much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dobe

customer_reviews.title: Really makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: They claim you can clean the pool with one hand. Yup, pretty much. That, and I just tried it out (and the pool looks great), with a sore shoulder from a tetanus shot. Pair with a sturdy pole and no more algae.
customer_reviews.author: BaconEggsandRice

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a pool brush check this one out
customer_reviews.text: Really helps keep the brush against walls and floor of pool with no real effort compared to standard brushes. I have a pebble tech pool and it appears to get more algae off the walls and floor of pool
customer_reviews.author: Use the Force

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical but it works
customer_reviews.text: I thought maybe the whaletale only work on 911's, but it does work in water. Bristles also stand up to wear and tear as well. I've had this product now for 2 years and it works and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Don't see what the hype is all about
customer_reviews.text: It works well...the only reason I'm giving it 3 stars is because it's not as "amazing" as I had heard/read about. I don't honestly see a huge difference between this brush and our old brush.
customer_reviews.author: Atxgurl

customer_reviews.title: Worthless if you need to scrub a stain.
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good if you are only needing to brush in a straight line. It is worthless if you need to scrub a stain. As soon as you start pulling back, the brush lifts off the bottom. This also makes it a little irritating to use on the sides of the pool since you each time you pull the brush back to the top, the paddle fights you.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The brush delivers as promised in the listing - provides easy brushing of the sides of the pool. The fin/flap really does push the bristles against the pool wall and requires very little pushing.
customer_reviews.author: txron01

product_meta.title: The Wall Whale Classic Swimming Pool Brush
product_meta.description: The wall whale is a swimming pool brush with a spoiler. The tail works like the spoiler on a car to hold the brush against the wall with more than 10x the force of a normal brush.
feature_bullets: The tail holds the brush against the wall with more than 10x the force
Great for routine brushing or tough algae problems

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,286 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
